column1: 3Q19 earnings was $1.58, beat consensus.Mortgage revenue reversed the weak 2Q19 results was up by 50% as compared to 3Q18.While refinancing tripled from the year-ago period, purchase volume was flat. At current level of interest rates, mortgage banking should hold up through the weaker winter months. However, it's unlikely to shown better results for another six months. Shares moved up from $50 level. I would not be a buyer at $56 per share.There may be upside down the road, but I am unable to ascertain.
